definition: to go far/to escape to faraway places
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
to fly high and run far (idiom); to leave in a hurry for a distance place

sentences.english: July, she will fly, and give no warning to her flight.
sentences.chinese: 七月，她遠走高飛，對我不辭而別。

sentences.english: Goofys strong play spirit to open the door.
sentences.chinese: 高飛強打起精神去開門。

sentences.english: Wings to fly away and excercise what's been taught them.
sentences.chinese: 翅膀讓他展翅高飛並且運用所學的知識。

sentences.english: We fly together, leapt to the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 我們攜手展翅高飛，躍上雲端。

sentences.english: "Peng" symbolizes the fly, for the future.
sentences.chinese: “鵬”象徵着展翅高飛，前程似錦。

sentences.english: Had it not been for his family, He'd have gone away long ago .
sentences.chinese: 要是沒有家眷拖累，他早就遠走高飛了。

sentences.english: When the soaring birds have all been slain, then good bows are stored away.
sentences.chinese: 高飛的鳥死了，良弓就要收藏起來。

sentences.english: Only then, can the group soar high and overcome any difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只有如許，一個組合才能降服重重堅苦，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: Redheaded clowns will have all gotten into their tiny cars and driven away, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 紅頭髮的小丑都坐上小車，遠走高飛，再也不回來了。

sentences.english: You go to dinner together and you feel as high as a kite.
sentences.chinese: 你們外出喫飯，你感覺自己像一隻高飛的風箏。

sentences.english: Come away with innocence, and leave me with my sins.
sentences.chinese: 帶着清白遠走高飛，帶着我的罪惡離我遠去。

sentences.english: I see flights of black birds rise against the green horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我看見成羣的黑色鳥兒從綠色的地平線振翅高飛。

sentences.english: But that hasn’t stopped young lovers from running away together.
sentences.chinese: 但這並不能阻礙現今的年輕戀人們一同遠走高飛。

sentences.english: Gofer breaks the eggs into the flour.
sentences.chinese: 高飛把雞蛋打到麪粉裏。

sentences.english: In fact one of the wiper blades began to flap off.
sentences.chinese: 事實上有一片雨刷的刮片已經決定自己振翅高飛了。

sentences.english: May our love soar on the wings of a dove in flight.
sentences.chinese: 願我們的愛乘着飛翔的白鴿，展翅高飛。

definition: to circle in the air/to soar
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
like a heavenly steed, soaring across the skies (idiom)/(of writing, calligraphy etc) bold and imaginative/unconstrained in style

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
to leave behind (inadvertently)/to forget/to omit/to leave out
